name: The Drowsy Chaperone Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who starts the story by listening to his favorite cast recording?
questions.explanation:
Man in Chair.

	Bob Martin originated the role of Man in Chair. He won a Theatre World award and was nominated for a Tony for his performance. Man in Chair is a rare thing, a main character in a musical who doesn't sing a song!

questions.text: What song was replaced by "Love is Always Lovely"?
questions.explanation:
I Remember Love.

	"Love is Always Lovely" is sung by Mrs. Tottendale and the Underling. The  roles were originated on Broadway by Georgia Engel and Edward Hibbert, respectively. You may remember Hibbert from "Frasier", where he played Gil Chesterton.

questions.text: What does Man in Chair eat during intermission?
questions.explanation:
A power bar.

	Bob Martin, the actor who originated the role, was married to the real-life Janet van de Graaf. In the show, Janet is played by Tony-winning actress Sutton Foster.

questions.text: According to the show, where did "The Drowsy Chaperone" premiere in 1928?
questions.explanation:
The Morosco Theater.

	The Second Stage is an Off-Broadway theater, and the Nederlander is a theater on Broadway itself. "The Drowsy Chaperone" itself opened in the Marquis Theatre.

questions.text: What is the name of the 'French girl' that Robert kisses?
questions.explanation:
Mimi.

	"Mimi" is a name that shows up in many musicals, from one of the strippers in "Miss Saigon" to Mimi Marquez in the rock opera "Rent". This Mimi's French origins are in dispute.

questions.text: What Gable & Stein show is the song "Message From a Nightingale" from?
questions.explanation:
The Enchanted Nightingale.

	In the show, "Message from a Nightingale" is sung by Adolpho, Kitty, the Gangsters and the Drowsy Chaperone herself!

questions.text: According to George, what is safer than tap dancing?
questions.explanation:
Rollerskating.

	My friends who have studied tap for several years dispute this claim, but I can tell you tbat rollerskating is indeed very dangerous, at least until you get the hang of it.

questions.text: What does the Chaperone call Aldolpho that causes him to sing "I Am Adolpho"?
questions.explanation:
"Adollface".

	Adolpho was originated on Broadway by Danny Burstein, whose previous credits include "Company" and "A Class Act". He was nominated for a Tony for his work with "Chaperone".

questions.text: Where is Janet when she sings "Show Off"?
questions.correct: By the pool of Mrs. Tottendale's house.
options: By the entrance to the theater.
Giving a press conference in City Hall.
questions.explanation:
By the pool of Mrs. Tottendale's house.

	Janet van de Graaf was originated on Broadway by Sutton Foster, who was awarded a Tony for her role in "Thoroughly Modern Millie" in 2002 and who was again nominated for her role in "Chaperone" in 2006. She has also been seen in "Little Women" and "Les Miserables", playing Eponine.

questions.text: What is the name of the lady that comes in to clean Man in Chair's house once a month?
questions.explanation:
Carmella.

	Carolee Carmello and Kelli O'Hara are the names of Broadway actresses, while "Mimi" is the name of the girl that Robert kisses.
